Instruction: Brew Espresso: Brew strong espresso and let it cool completely. Stir in the Kahlua.
Dip Ladyfingers: Quickly dip ladyfingers in the espresso mixture, one at a time, and arrange them in a single layer in the bottom of a glass baking dish.
Whip Cream: In a large bowl, beat the heavy whipping cream and sugar until stiff peaks form.
Combine Mascarpone and Cream: In a separate bowl, beat the mascarpone cheese until smooth. Gently fold in the whipped cream and vanilla extract.
Layer Tiramisu: Spoon a layer of the mascarpone mixture over the ladyfingers. Repeat layers of ladyfingers dipped in espresso and mascarpone mixture, ending with a layer of mascarpone mixture.
Refrigerate: Cover the tiramisu with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 4 hours, or preferably overnight, to allow the flavors to meld.
Dust and Serve: Before serving, dust the top of the tiramisu with cocoa powder.  Optional: Garnish with chocolate shavings.
